org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution

Class FourierConvolve

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution.FourierConvolve
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageProcessor<FImage>, Processor<FImage>, SinglebandImageProcessor<Float,FImage>

    public class FourierConvolve
extends Object
implements SinglebandImageProcessor<Float,FImage>
    FImage convolution performed in the fourier domain.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • processImage

        public void processImage(FImage image)
        Description copied from interface: ImageProcessor
        Process an image. Implementing classes must alter the image passed in-place or assign the output to the input using Image.internalAssign(Image).
        Specified by:
        processImage in interface ImageProcessor<FImage>
        Parameters:
        image - The image to process in place.

      • convolve

        public static FImage convolve(FImage image,
                              float[][] kernel,
                              boolean inplace)
        Convolve an image with a kernel using an FFT.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to convolve
        kernel - The kernel
        inplace - if true, then output overwrites the input, otherwise a new image is created.
        Returns:
        convolved image

      • convolvePrepared

        public static FImage convolvePrepared(FImage image,
                                      FImage filter,
                                      boolean centered)
        Convolve an image with a pre-prepared frequency domain filter. The filter must have the same height as the image and twice the width (to account for the imaginary components). Real and imaginary components should be interlaced across the rows.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to convolve
        filter - the prepared frequency domain filter
        centered - true if the prepared filter has the highest frequency in the centre.
        Returns:
        convolved image
